intro: Lindackeria poggei, commonly known as the Bog Rosemary, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of North America. It is a member of the heather family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and needle-like, adapted to thrive in moist, acidic soils. Lindackeria poggei plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland habitats and providing nectar for pollinators.
